item.title: Unraveling the context of context
Keynote at CRUM 2024
item.description:
I have the great pleasure giving a keynote at the 2nd Workshop on Context Representation in User Modeling (CRUM 2024), which wild be held in the scope of UMAP 2024 in Cagliari, Italy. CRUM will be held on 1st of July—so, there is still some time until then.

Unraveling the context of context
Keynote at CRUM 2024.
1 July 2024

item.title: Wie funktionieren (Musik-) Empfehlungssysteme? Und ist es für alle fair, was ich zu hören bekomme?
Breaking feedback loops in recommender systems: an example on mitigating artist gender bias in the music domain
Music recommendation systems from the perspective of artists: what constitutes fairness?
Keynote: Help!—Bridging the Gap Between Music Technology and Diverse Stakeholder Needs
Keynote at ISMIR 2023
item.description:
I feel very honored to give a keynote address at ISMIR 2023. I will address the multifaceted needs of stakeholders who rely on the technologies revolving around music information retrieval (MIR). In particular, I will zoom in examples from music recommender systems and demonstrate the potential risks of neglecting artists’ needs—and provide strategies for mitigation.


Keynote: Help!—Bridging the Gap Between Music Technology and Diverse Stakeholder Needs
Keynote at ISMIR 2023.
6 November 2023
Video

item.title: Evaluating recommender systems: survey and framework
item.description:
Eva Zangerle, Christine Bauer (2022). Evaluating recommender systems: survey and framework. ACM Computing Surveys.

item.title: Keynote: Keep an eye on the big picture—in recommender systems research and as a scientist
item.description:
During today's #WomenInRecSys keynote series @christine_bauer shares the importance of looking at the big picture not only in #RecSys research but also in our paths as scientists. More info: https://t.co/oGRMtbGvjT @ACMRecSys pic.twitter.com/LdPMdJIEJB

— Sole Pera (@DrCh0le) August 30, 2023

item.title: Keynote at Women in RecSys 2023
item.description:
I am looking forward to giving a keynote at the Women in RecSys 2023 Keynote Series next Wednesday (30 August 2023). It will take place online (via Zoom) and everyone is welcome to attend.

Also watch out for the other keynotes that are yet to come on 6 and 13 September 2023.



Keynote: Keep an eye on the big picture—in recommender systems research and as a scientist
Keynote at Women in RecSys 2023.
30 August 2023
Slides

item.title: Keynote at IIR 2023
item.description:
I have the great pleasure giving a keynote at the 13th Italian Information Retrieval Workshop (IIR 2023) next week. I am looking forward to two days with many talks on exciting topics.

Keynote: Three views of a secret: Embracing multiple perspectives in the evaluation of information retrieval and recommender systems
IIR 2023 Keynote.
9 June 2023

item.title: Musikempfehlungssysteme aus der Perspektive von Artists: Was ist fair?
Keynote: K.I. in der Musikbranche: Last oder Lösung?—Ethische Fragen im Zusammenhang mit Algorithmen
Keynote at Future Music Camp 2023 in Mannheim
item.description: It is a pleasure to give a keynote address at the Future Music Camp 2023, organized by the Popakademie Baden-Württemberg (University for Music Business, Creative Industries and Popular Music) in Mannheim, Germany.

item.title: Fairness—Are algorithms a burden or a solution?
Context matters: An example of country context in music recommender systems
What is fair? The artists' perspective on music recommenders
Keynote: Celebrating an engaged music community and breaking the bias
Keynote: In the user is it—is it?: If you want to understand your users, you have to understand their situations
item.description: Christine Bauer (2021). In the user is it – is it?: If you want to understand your users, you have to understand their situations. Keynote at the Workshop “Transparency and Explainability in Adaptive Systems Through User Modelling Grounded in Psychological Theory (HUMANIZE 2021), co-located with IUI 2021. Online, 13 April.

item.title: The videos of all the ComplexRec2020 workshop talks are online
item.description:
The videos of all ComplexRec 2020 workshop talks at RecSys 2020—including my keynote—can now be found on the RecSys YouTube channel.


Christine Bauer (2020). Ratings in, rankings out. Keep it simple, they said. But we need more than that.. Proceedings of the Recommendation in Complex Scenarios and the Impact of Recommender Systems 2020 (ComplexRec-ImpactRS 2020).

item.title: I'll be guiding a virtual session of WiMIR workshop 2020
item.description:
I am happy to announce that I will be guiding one of the nine virtual sessions of the WiMIR workshop 2020 at ISMIR 2020. The title of my session is: The best ever recommendation & For who? And how do you know that?

I am very much looking forward to it.

Registration information will be announced soon. Follow @Women_MIR to not miss any news.

The WiMIR workshop is going virtual with nine sessions with MIR all-stars! These sessions will be spread across four weekends (and timezones) leading up to #vISMIR2020. Registration information coming soon.#WiMIR2020 #WomenInMIR #WiMIRworkshop @ismir2020

— Women in MIR (@Women_MIR) August 7, 2020

item.title: Keynote at ComplexRec 2020
item.description:
I am honored to announce that I am invited to give the keynote at the 4th Workshop on Recommendation in Complex Environments (ComplexRec 2020), co-located with RecSys 2020. The fancy ;-) title of my talk is: Ratings in, rankings out. Keep it simple, they said. But we need more than that.

Christine Bauer (2020). Ratings in, rankings out. Keep it simple, they said. But we need more than that.. Proceedings of the Recommendation in Complex Scenarios and the Impact of Recommender Systems 2020 (ComplexRec-ImpactRS 2020).

PDF Cite

item.title: My Talk at PrivacyWeek 2019 is finally online
item.description:
You missed my talk at PrivacyWeek 2019? Just watch it now :-). It’s 53 minutes long.

You can also download it from the media.ccc.de archive. Optionally, you can choose the audio track ‘‘English’’, where you hear the simultaneous translation into English.

item.title: Watch my PrivacyWeek talk at Relive
item.description: See my PrivacyWeek talk on Sag mir, was du hörst—und ich sage dir, wer du bist at Relive until it will be archived on the Media Site of the Chaos Computer Club Germany.

item.title: Sag mir, was du hörst—und ich sage dir, wer du bist!
item.description:
Sketch of my talk at @PrivacyWeek #pw19
I love ❤️ this sketch. And I feel honored :-) https://t.co/GfygxQNrwb

— Christine Bauer (@christine_bauer) October 27, 2019

item.title: My talk at PrivacyWeek 2019 is scheduled for Sun, 27 October
item.description:
The program of PrivacyWeek 2019 is online!
My talk with the title Sag mir, was du hörst—und ich sage dir, wer du bist! (in German) is scheduled for Sunday, 27 October 2019, 15:00–15:45 in room ‘‘Saal 1’’.

Hope to see you there!

item.title: Music Information Retrieval: Inside and Outside the Music
Additional talk at AIxMusic Festival on Sunday, 8 September
item.description:
Besides holding a workshop on the festival’s second day (Friday), I will give a talk on ‘‘Music Information Retrieval: Inside and Outside the Music’’; together with Peter Knees at the AIxMusic Matinée on Sunday, 8 September 2019.
Note, the talk is announced with the title ‘‘Music Information & Music Data’’.

item.title: Workshop at AIxMusic Festival in scope of the 2019 Ars Electronica Festival
item.description: I happily announce that I will hold a workshop with the title Recommenders and Intelligent Tools in Music Creation: Why, Why Not, and How? at AIxMusic Festival in scope of the 2019 Ars Electronica Festival—together with my co-speakers Peter Knees, Richard Vogl, and Hansi Raber.

item.title: Speaker at PrivacyWeek 2019 in Vienna
item.description: I’m happy to announce that I will give a talk at this year’s PrivacyWeek 2019 – Privat, oida! organized by Chaos Computer Club Wien (C3W) in October. Stay tuned!

item.title: Speaker at RecSys Summer School 2019
item.description: I am happy to be a speaker at the ACM Summer School on Recommender Systems taking place in Gothenburg, Sweden, just a week before the official RecSys 2019 in Copenhagen, Denmark.

item.title: Aftermath to NGI#3 ''AI and beyond''
item.description: You can find a nice summary (in German) of the third NGI event on ‘‘AI and beyond’’, where I gave a talk last month: https://ngi.ait.ac.at/aftermath-to-ngi3-ai-and-beyond/

item.title: Wie wird Artificial Intelligence die Art und Weise verändern, wie wir Computer wahrnehmen und mit ihnen umgehen?
I'll give a talk at NGI Talk
item.description:
I am happy to announce that I will give a talk at the event NGI Talk #3: AI and beyond on ‘‘How will AI change the way we perceive and interact with computers?’’

Afterwards, I will join the panel discussion.

The event is organized by the AIT Austrian Institute of Technology. It will take place at OCG in Vienna, Austria, on 3 June 2019.
